00019 template< typename T >
00020 void DataOStreamArchive::save_array( const boost::serialization::array< T >& a,
00021                                      unsigned int )
00022 {
00023     _stream << Array< const T >( a.address(), a.count( ));
00024 }
00025 
00026 template< class C, class T, class A >
00027 void DataOStreamArchive::save( const std::basic_string< C, T, A >& s )
00028 {
00029     // implementation only valid for narrow string
00030     BOOST_STATIC_ASSERT( sizeof(C) == sizeof(char));
00031     _stream << s;
00032 }
00033 
00034 template< typename T >
00035 typename boost::enable_if< boost::is_integral<T> >::type
00036 DataOStreamArchive::save( const T& t )
00037 {
00038 #if BOOST_VERSION < 104800
00039     namespace bs = boost::detail;
00040 #else
00041     namespace bs = boost::spirit::detail;
00042 #endif
00043 
00044     if( T temp = t )
00045     {
00046         // examine the number of bytes
00047         // needed to represent the number
00048         signed char size = 0;
00049         do
00050         {
00051 #pragma clang diagnostic push
00052 #pragma clang diagnostic ignored "-Wshift-count-overflow"
00053             temp >>= CHAR_BIT;
00054 #pragma clang diagnostic pop
00055             ++size;
00056         }
00057         while( temp != 0 && temp != (T) -1 );
00058 
00059         // encode the sign bit into the size
00060         _saveSignedChar( t > 0 ? size : -size );
00061         BOOST_ASSERT( t > 0 || boost::is_signed<T>::value) ;
00062 
00063         // we choose to use little endian because this way we just
00064         // save the first size bytes to the stream and skip the rest
00065         bs::store_little_endian<T, sizeof(T)>( &temp, t );
00066         save_binary( &temp, size );
00067     }
00068     else
00069         // zero optimization
00070         _saveSignedChar (0 );
00071 }
00072 
00073 template< typename T >
00074 typename boost::enable_if< boost::is_floating_point<T> >::type
00075 DataOStreamArchive::save( const T& t )
00076 {
00077     namespace fp = boost::spirit::math;
00078 
00079     typedef typename fp::detail::fp_traits<T>::type traits;
00080 
00081     // if the no_infnan flag is set we must throw here
00082     if( get_flags() & serialization::no_infnan && !fp::isfinite( t ))
00083         throw DataStreamArchiveException( t );
00084 
00085     // if you end here there are three possibilities:
00086     // 1. you're serializing a long double which is not portable
00087     // 2. you're serializing a double but have no 64 bit integer
00088     // 3. your machine is using an unknown floating point format
00089     // after reading the note above you still might decide to
00090     // deactivate this static assert and try if it works out.
00091     typename traits::bits bits;
00092     BOOST_STATIC_ASSERT( sizeof(bits) == sizeof(T));
00093     BOOST_STATIC_ASSERT( std::numeric_limits<T>::is_iec559 );
00094 
00095     // examine value closely
00096     switch( fp::fpclassify( t ))
00097     {
00098     case FP_ZERO:
00099         bits = 0;
00100         break;
00101     case FP_NAN:
00102         bits = traits::exponent | traits::mantissa;
00103         break;
00104     case FP_INFINITE:
00105         bits = traits::exponent | (t<0) * traits::sign;
00106         break;
00107     case FP_SUBNORMAL:
00108         assert( std::numeric_limits<T>::has_denorm );
00109     case FP_NORMAL:
00110         traits::get_bits(t, bits);
00111         break;
00112     default:
00113         throw DataStreamArchiveException( t );
00114     }
00115 
00116     save( bits );
00117 }
